⚙️ React & Next.js Optimization Codex ⚙️

React.memo

Prevents unnecessary re-renders of functional components by memoizing the result unless props change.

Node.js Event Loop Awareness

Understanding how the event loop works allows you to write more efficient asynchronous code.

Avoid JavaScript Memory Leaks

Leaks happen when memory is retained unnecessarily. Clean up references, listeners, and timers.

API Pagination

Never return unbounded data. Always paginate large results from your API.

API Rate Limiting

Limit requests to prevent abuse and protect server resources.

Code Splitting (Dynamic Imports)

Split bundles to reduce initial load time.

useMemo and useCallback

Memoize functions and values to avoid unnecessary re-creation.

Image Optimization

Use Next.js <Image> component for optimal performance.

Lazy Loading Components

Load components only when needed to reduce initial bundle size.

Prefetching Data

Load data in advance to improve perceived performance.

Debounce and Throttle Events

Limit how often expensive functions run in response to frequent events.

Use Web Workers for Heavy Computations

Offload CPU-intensive tasks to background threads.

SSR Caching Strategies

Cache server-side rendered pages or data to speed up responses.

Bundle Analyzing

Analyze and optimize JavaScript bundle size.

Critical CSS Extraction

Inline above-the-fold CSS to speed up first paint.

HTTP/2 Multiplexing

Serve multiple assets over a single connection for faster loads.
